name: Popover
description: Interactive popover component with collapsible content panel that reveals additional information or controls when triggered by user interaction.

is_new_window.description: Whether to open link in a new window.

group.description: Group name for controlling multiple popovers together.

when_to_use: Provide additional context or help information without cluttering the interface
Show detailed explanations for complex terms or concepts
Display supplementary content that's not always needed
Create expandable sections for optional information
when_not_to_use: For critical information that users must see
On mobile devices where space is very limited
For content that should be easily scannable
When the trigger text isn't self-explanatory
For content that needs to be indexed by search engines
best_practices: Make trigger text descriptive and actionable
Keep popover content concise and focused
Ensure popovers work well on both desktop and mobile devices
Use appropriate z-index to ensure popovers appear above other content
Group related popovers together to prevent multiple from opening simultaneously
Provide keyboard navigation support for accessibility
Consider the positioning and ensure content doesn't get cut off

accessibility.notes: Popovers should be keyboard accessible and announced properly to screen readers. The collapsible functionality provides proper ARIA states.

known_issues: Content positioning may need adjustment on smaller screens
Multiple popovers in the same group will close each other when opened
variations: Basic popover: Simple trigger and content panel
Multi-section popover: Top, main, and bottom content areas
Grouped popovers: Multiple popovers that coordinate their open/close state
